title: Display typeface – London, Stoke Newington, 1981
content:
Hello,

Would you know which typeface this is?

Thank you!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Recorder house.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417175709/http:/typophile.com/files/Recorder%20house.jpg) | 344.4 KB |
author: Géraldine

comments.content:
I presume that your reference to 1981 refers to the date of the photograph. The building is obviously much older, perhaps pre-WWI.  
As for the sign I note the difference in the two \_E\_ letters.  
Seems that part of the letter has broken off.  
Not a new sign. But I wonder when it was installed.  
Until recent decades large sign letters were designed by various makers who did not necessarily base them on a specific font.  
But I trust someone will suggest some sources for matching individual letters.  
The low waist \_R\_ with a straight leg from where the bowl meets the vertical stroke, and the top heavy \_S\_ are a fair match to Erbar Grotesk Extra Garnitur introduced by Ludwig & Mayer Frankfurt in 1927.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417175709im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ErbarGroteskGarnitur1927SM_6491.jpg)
  
This version of Erbar is not digitized.  
Don

As for the \_E\_, which I cleaned up to look like this

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417175709im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RecorderHouseTypophile122402_E_SM_5323.jpg)
  
I did not find a match with a font.  
Perhaps someone else can help?  
Don
